importantArticles.headline: GM is set to sell its entire stake in the Lansing, MI, battery plant to LG Energy for about $2.08 billion to scale back EV expansion due to slowing sales.
importantArticles.title: General Motors to Sell Michigan Battery Plant to LG Energy for $2B

importantArticles.headline: The Fort Wayne facility is equipped to produce Chevrolet Silverado and GMC Sierra trucks.
importantArticles.title: GM reportedly plans to boost truck production in Indiana, US

importantArticles.headline: GM sells 442,000 vehicles in China in Q1, almost flat year over year but down sequentially. With rising local competition, GM faces a tough battle ahead.
importantArticles.title: How's General Motors Faring in China Amid Fierce Competition?

importantArticles.headline: Trump's tariffs have thrown the auto industry into turmoil, with Canada hitting back. Consumers and automakers now brace up for rising costs and disruptions.
importantArticles.title: Canada's Retaliatory Tariffs Fuel Trump's Trade War, Roil Auto Sector

importantArticles.headline: The Fort Wayne facility is equipped to produce Chevrolet Silverado and GMC Sierra trucks.
importantArticles.title: GM reportedly plans to boost truck production in Indiana, US

importantArticles.headline: DETROIT (Reuters) -General Motors plans to increase production of light-duty trucks at its Fort Wayne, Indiana, assembly plant, it said in a webcast sent to plant employees on Thursday and viewed by Reuters, after President Donald Trump announced 25% tariffs on auto imports.  GM CEO Mary Barra had hinted at the possibility of increasing the output of trucks in the United States during GM's January earnings call in response to tariffs.
importantArticles.title: Exclusive-GM to increase truck production in Indiana following Trump's tariffs

importantArticles.headline: When it comes to U.S. auto company investors, the big question most want answered right now involves the potential impact on these companies' bottom line.  What happened with auto-related tariffs?  The Trump administration enacted a 25% tariff on April 3 on any vehicle not assembled in the U.S. President Donald Trump has said he also plans to place tariffs on some auto parts (including engines and transmissions), but those won't take effect until May 3.
importantArticles.title: Tariffs Will Cost This Detroit Automaker Billions More Than Its Rival

importantArticles.headline: President Trump's 25% auto tariffs are now in effect. Yahoo Finance Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian takes a closer look at how some of the major automakers are responding. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
importantArticles.title: Trump's auto tariffs: Here's how automakers are responding
